data.prayer: Spirit, teach the 92 believers in Laghouat that when they seek first your Kingdom and your righteousness, you will abundantly provide all they need.
data.verse: And God is able to bless you abundantly, so that in all things at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Laghouat, Algeria
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Father, let knowledge and depth of insight abound more and more in the church of Laghouat, Algeria.
data.verse: And this is my prayer: that your love may abound more and more in knowledge and depth of insight,

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 1460 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Father, please remove the barriers that keep the 134,297 who are far from you in Laghouat, Algeria from having access to a Bible.
data.verse: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.

data.prayer: Lord, please provide elders whose hearts are completely yours in every town in the state of Laghouat.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.prayer: Father, I pray that the Bedouin, Laguat people will not be afraid or ashamed. Prevent them from being confounded or disappointed in their search for you. May the Bedouin, Laguat people know you.
Spirit, protect the overcomers in Laghouat, Algeria, so that they will one day sit with Jesus on His throne.
data.verse: He who overcomes, I will give to him to sit down with me on my throne, as I also overcame, and sat down with my Father on his throne.

data.prayer: Spirit, give the believers of the the state of Laghouat unity and humility as they work to bring the kingdom to new people and places.
Father, please raise up new apostles to pioneer the growth of the church in Laghouat.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up
